Molding a single
spider
One needs to plant it on the
clay
slab
, as has been said, on a
vine
leaf, and make there your first cast; & once it has set, uncover the
spider
up to half its legs, then make the second cast.
In order
The hairy feet of large
spiders
, like any animal hair, does not mold well if it is not flattened, having anointed it with
wheat
oil
, which stiffens it & is quickly dry. Hairy things mix with the
sand
& do not burn well.
